p: Samples from oral cavity, tongue tip, and gingival groove were collected using a sterile swab. The specimens were cultured on a Mueller-Hinton agar medium (Merck, KGaA) containing 5% sheep blood and incubated at 37°C for 18 to 24 hr. Bacteria were isolated and diagnosed on the basis of colony morphology, Gram staining, and biochemical tests. Furthermore, four standard bacterial strains Actinomyces viscousus (PTCC1202), Eikenella corrodens (PTCC1391), Streptococcus sanguis (PTCC1449), and Streptococcus viridans (PTCC1774) from Iranian Scientific and Industrial Research Organization, were prepared and incubated in Brain Heart Infusion Broth at 37°C.
